Author: yuvadeep
Title: [ANN]Raincheck - Global loyalty & rewards points exchange aggregator on Stellar
Body: RainCheck came up with a new plan where it goes beyond the range of online and offline. It is a commerce platform that helps all the retail brands that track and controls through an online product that discovers in the store all the sales. RainCheck offers to link their credit or debit cards this leads to add offers to the people, gaining loyalty points or cash-back to any debit or credit payment card.  RainCheck is one of the first and best organizations in the world with a commerce platform that reaches all the points to all the players. RainCheck provides a solution not only to the users who individualize their shopping experience, for both online and offline, but it offers a retail brand that helps them to measure digital marketing that spends through offline. RainCheck decided to build a decentralized loyalty platform on the stellar blockchain platform. Stellar connects not only to banks, payments systems and people around the world. RainCheck provides a plan to all the consumers to combine their reward points from multiple loyalty schemes into one digital unit, the Rain Token. The Rain Token creates a takeaway transfer mechanism on the RainCheck Commerce Platform.  Therefore, this token is designed on the stellar protocol, that is specially designed to allow all the micro-payments that can handle all the transactions very fast and at a very low cost.

Author: willraincheck
Title: [ANN]Raincheck - Global loyalty & rewards points exchange aggregator on Stellar
Body: The rewards pool is only used for the token circulation of RainCheck business ecosystem.  https://image.raincheck.biz/raincheck/raintoken-economics.png  Token Inflow Customers can use reward tokens to buy cash voucher to use in the offline store of O2O partnership merchants. The tokens will be recycled to rewards pool. Customers can use reward tokens to buy products through cross border ecommerce. The tokens will be recycled to the rewards pool. RainCheck will periodically buy back tokens to fulfill the needs of the rewards pool with profits from the business.  Token Outflow Customers can earn reward tokens when they download and install the app. Customers can earn reward tokens by buying products through cross border ecommerce. Customers can earn reward tokens through card-linked offer when they shopping and entertaining. RainCheck will periodically buy back and burn out tokens with profits from the business.

Author: Sammied
Title: [ANN]Raincheck - Global loyalty & rewards points exchange aggregator on Stellar
Body: Hi Alvena,  Raincheck supports Shopify and Magento merchants to import their product inventory into RainCheck through Shopify and Magento API. So the merchant products can be list in our mobile app. If the merchant wants to allow users to buy through the app, we allow users to buy products through Stripe payment gateway inside the app. By extending the platform to add RAIN as loyalty program, we can reward users RAIN tokens if they buy through the app, raincheck products and so on. If the merchant has their loyalty program, we can integrate it and allow users to exchange between RAIN and merchant loyalty points. If not, RAIN will be the merchant loyalty program. The benefit for consumers and merchants is they will have a universal loyalty program. And they only need one loyalty card, which is the bank card to earn loyalty points from merchants by card-linked offers. Hope it helps. 😄

Author: Vladdirescu87
Title: [ANN]Raincheck - Global loyalty & rewards points exchange aggregator on Stellar
Body: Raincheck — Global Bonus System and Loyalty Program on the Stellar Blockchain  RainCheck focuses on the o2o industry. O2o means ‘online to offline’ commerce, a term used to describe the strategy of bringing online customers to real-world shopping locations. The RainCheck app helps the offline shopping experience by alerting shoppers when they are near items they have previously browsed online, then rewarding them with RAIN tokens through debit / credit card linking when a purchase is made.  Raincheck created on the basis of the Stellar blockchain, with its own RAIN token, and fast transactions. The user registers on the platform through the procedure KYC-AML, and attaches its payment cards through the application-wallet. Further, getting bonuses for purchases in offline and online stores, the user registers them on the platform, and receives in return a particular number of RAIN tokens that can be displayed on a bank card in cash equivalent or exchanged for bonuses in a particular store. Through the use of an online platform, stores will receive information about the purchases of a particular person in offline, and will be able to offer the buyer what he is interested in. And users will no longer lose unnecessary bonuses in one store, instead of it simply transfer them to another.  Read the details in the article of Coinidol dot com, the world blockchain news outlet: https://medium.com/@Vladar49/raincheck-global-bonus-system-and-loyalty-program-on-the-stellar-blockchain-fd3ae5458dd8

Author: willraincheck
Title: [ANN]Raincheck - Global loyalty & rewards points exchange aggregator on Stellar
Body: Hello royalfestus, thanks for your interest. Stellar has a built-in decentralized exchange (DEX) capability, so RAIN tokens will be listed on StellarPort and StellarX from day 1. We have investigated KYC issues with our third-party vendor and has improved the process. Hope it will be more smoother in future. We apologize for the inconvenience for our investors. We do encourage you to read our white paper to find out more details about how RainCheck and RAIN token works.  And our Ukraine team is building the iOS wallet functions now. Users will be able to Create a Stellar account, Import existing Stellar account, Send Stellar to another Stellar account, Receive Stellar by scan QR code, Check RAIN token balance and so on. Users can also convert loyalty points from different loyalty schemes to RAIN tokens. We will keep updating the progress. Stay tuned. Thanks.

Author: willraincheck
Title: [ANN]Raincheck - Global loyalty & rewards points exchange aggregator on Stellar
Body: Hello Dasengineer, thanks for your interest in our project.  Stellar network and protocol has faster transaction speed compared with ETH. It also supports cross border payment very well. That’s why we choose Stellar for RAIN token because we need to process transactions quickly when users redeem loyalty points to RAIN tokens, purchase products through mobile app by paying RAIN tokens etc.  RAIN token is designed as a utility token. Besides the 35% tokens allocated for ICO, we also allocate 25% tokens as Rewards Pool used to work with merchants together to promote RainCheck mobile app, O2O activities, brands, Diagou activities. Through these activities, we can increase the circulation of RAIN tokens in all commercial activities of the whole ecosystem.  Once consumers receive RAIN tokens from the Rewards Pool, we will definitely allow users to transfer a certain percentage of tokens to exchange to cash out. Meanwhile, we will also ensure there are enough tokens to meet the circulation needs of commercial activities in the ecosystem. We will balance the circulation needs of both commercial activities and the crypto exchange.  When more and more people are willing to use RAIN tokens in commercial activities in the ecosystem, more and more people will need RAIN tokens. Because of the fixed supply of the RAIN tokens, we will expect the value increase of the RAIN token. The value increase of RAIN will also help to attract more people to join the ecosystem to use RAIN tokens to buy products, redeem loyalty points, redeem brand offer and so on.  Hope it helps. Thanks.

Author: mittill
Title: [ANN]Raincheck - Global loyalty & rewards points exchange aggregator on Stellar
Body: The team is talented enough to know Stellar is a better option than Ethereum for this project. Here, read fresh analysis from the resource hacked, which gives a goodrating project  ICO Analysis: RainCheck Published on September 4, 2018 By Joshua Larson Proof: https://hacked.com/ico-analysis-raincheck/  Team RainCheck was established in 2014, their current team consists of 11 employees and 12 advisors. Cameron Wall is the Co-Founder. Stanford Grad. 25 years of experience in tech. “Founded various tech startups included hardware and software-based systems. Some successful exits and some failures. Technology and timing of the market are crucial to success. ” William Lin is the other Co-Founder. Lots of experience as a Mobile Developer, including 8 years at Motorola. Peter Bremner is the Chief Partnership & Strategy Officer. 20+ years tech experience. Was recently Director at AwareIT where he developed relationships with companies like HP, Cisco, and IBM. Bin Wang is an expert in Blockchain and Big Data and has four years as Software Engineer at Motorola. He spent six years as Tech Manager at Kuyun Interactive. The 12 advisors all look like legit experts in their specific fields. Pretty Impressive.  Verdict We barely scratched the service when it comes to explaining this project. Please dive into the whitepaper to learn all about things such as their loyalty scheme smart contracts which will be released in Q1 2019.  Risk     Plenty of competition with more to come soon.  (Loyalty Token, Bitrewards, Incent) -1     Would like to see much more transparency when it comes to what they plan to do with the funds. -1     Even though they will need lots of marketing, The $24 million hardcap could scare investors away.-1     The App has been out at least since 2016, yet only has 500 downloads on google apps store. Telegram has only 200 members. -1.5  Growth Potential     Real work being done. Active GitHub and the whitepaper is clearly written by professionals. Been around since 2014, App available here.+2 https://www.getraincheck.com/home/     The value of the loyalty rewards market is almost $500 billion annually with global marketing spend soon reaching $1 trillion ($225B Digital) +1     The team looks very capable. +2     One of the first projects on Stellar, should get love from the community. +2     Revenue model. Generated by subscription, transaction fees, loyalty marketing and data services. +1.5     RainCheck will eventually develop its own payment gateway and become a Stellar anchor by deploying its own Stellar Core, Horizon, Bridge Server, Federation Server and Compliance Server. +1.5   However, the lack of fanfare/users after being out since 2015, is concerning. 5.5/10  Investment Details     Symbol: RAIN     Platform: Stellar     Total Supply: 2,000,000,000 (2 billion)     Available for Sale: 700 million     Price: $0.04     Soft Cap: $6 million     Hardcap: $28 million     Presale:  Live until November 4th     Crowdsale: November 5-30th

Title: [ANN]Raincheck - Global loyalty & rewards points exchange aggregator on Stellar

Author: willraincheck
Title: [ANN]Raincheck - Global loyalty & rewards points exchange aggregator on Stellar
Body: Hi AmoreJaz, we will develop the SDK to onboard merchants. Actually, the RAIN token is an extension of our current card-linked loyalty program we are building now. Our solution can provide cashback based on the card-linked offer of three major schemes, Visa, MasterCard, and AMEX. Generally, merchants don't truly like cashback because they want consumers to spend more. RainCheck gives an option for merchants to customized card-linked offer using cashback and loyalty points together. Whether merchants have their own loyalty program or not, they can use the SDK and Smart Contract to plug into the RainCheck universal loyalty program based on RAIN token. We are building the RAIN wallet which will be integrated into our existing RainCheck mobile app for users to exchange between loyalty points and RAIN tokens easily. Hope my explanation helps, thank you.

Author: setpass
Title: [ANN]Raincheck - Global loyalty & rewards points exchange aggregator on Stellar
Body: The RAIN Token has been created to carry out a transfer mechanism on the RainCheck Commerce Platform. This token is based on the Stellar protocol, which was specially designed to enable micro-payments that can handle very fast transactions at very low cost. To facilitate access to the RainCheck Platform and its functions, such as rewards trading, a new Stellar based token will be created, called the RAIN Token. At the time of issue, the RAIN Token will be used as the value unit within a loyalty DAO. RAIN Tokens will be staked by brands in relation to their community membership. Thanks to the micropayments feature, RainCheck is able to monitor rewards points value available from organizations in real time, and thus inform consumers of the current value and the exact source of rewards in real-time. People who receive or purchase RAIN Tokens will be able to trade these between loyalty programs and schemes. They also have the ability to trade them at any time on exchanges that support the RAIN Token. Merchants and brands can use the RainCheck platform to issue RAIN Tokens for carrying out tasks such as saving discovered items online and actually purchasing items from merchants, also engaging with marketing campaigns from brands.

Author: iwasneverhere
Title: [ANN]Raincheck - Global loyalty & rewards points exchange aggregator on Stellar
Body: Can you explain more what does SCP stands for? PoW means Proof of Work but I wonder what exactly SCP is, is it a PoS with the modified system?

Author: Zye
Title: [ANN]Raincheck - Global loyalty & rewards points exchange aggregator on Stellar
Body: Hello there! SCP means "Stellar Consensus Protocol" "The SCP provides a way to reach consensus without relying on a closed system to accurately record financial transactions. SCP has a set of provable safety properties that optimize for safety over liveness—in the event of partition or misbehaving nodes, it halts progress of the network until consensus can be reached. SCP simultaneously enjoys four key properties: decentralized control, low latency, flexible trust, and asymptotic security" From Page 31 of the Whitepaper! Link below!  https://raincheck-ico-static.s3.amazonaws.com/static/file/RAIN-Token-White-Paper.pdf

Author: Felicisimoiii
Title: [ANN]Raincheck - Global loyalty & rewards points exchange aggregator on Stellar
Body: Hey there! Good question! This is from the RainCheck team,  "RAIN Tokens are issued on the more secure Stellar network, not the Ethereum network.  Ethereum tokens are issued to the ERC20 Token Standard.  ERC20 tokens are easy to issue and are infinitely customisable using Ethereum’s smart contracting language but recent events have highlighted some weaknesses of using ERC20, including smart contract security issues and very slow transaction processing.  Many organisations with only basic tokens use the Ethereum’s risky Turing-complete programming language.  RAIN Tokens use the more secure Stellar model, without the full functionality (and potential pitfalls) of Turing-complete smart contracts.  Stellar’s model of simple atomic declarative multi-operation transactions leads to better auditable code and limits uncertainty and risk.  Stellar Smart Contracts are implemented as an agreement between multiple parties and enforced by transactions using Stellar –provided APIs with huge benefits in cost and confirmation time."  Also, Stellar can be traded from day 1, meaning RAIN will be tradeable from day 1.  Hope that helps!

Author: Felicisimoiii
Title: [ANN]Raincheck - Global loyalty & rewards points exchange aggregator on Stellar
Body: Hi! Thank you for asking. This is from the whitepaper pg 31, also included on that page is a visual comparison between SCP, POW, POS, Byzantine, and Tendermint: https://raincheck-ico-static.s3.amazonaws.com/static/file/RAIN-Token-White-Paper.pdf  5.2 Stellar Consensus Protocol The SCP provides a way to reach consensus without relying on a closed system to accurately record financial transactions. SCP has a set of provable safety properties that optimize for safety over liveness—in the event of partition or misbehaving nodes, it halts progress of the network until consensus can be reached. SCP simultaneously enjoys four key properties: decentralized control, low latency, flexible trust, and asymptotic security.  Please visit https://www.stellar.org/developers/guides/concepts/scp.html for more details
